question:
You are a math expert. When you respond, respond only with the Solution of the final Problem, thinking step by step. At the end of the Solution, when you give your final answer, write it in the form 'Final Answer: \\boxed{$answer$}. I hope it is correct.'
Find all values of $x$ such that
\[
\begin{vmatrix} 1 & 1 & 1 \\ x & 7 & -2 \\ x^3 & 343 & -8 \end{vmatrix}
= 0.\]Enter your values separated by commas.  For example, if you think the possible values are 4, 5, and 6, then enter you answer as "4,5,6".
inference:
We can expand the determinant as follows:
\begin{align*}
\begin{vmatrix} 1 & 1 & 1 \\ x & 7 & -2 \\ x^3 & 343 & -8 \end{vmatrix} &= 1 \begin{vmatrix} 7 & -2 \\ 343 & -8 \end{vmatrix} - 1 \begin{vmatrix} x & -2 \\ x^3 & -8 \end{vmatrix} + 1 \begin{vmatrix} x & 7 \\ x^3 & 343 \end{vmatrix} \\
&= (-56 + 686) - (-8x + 2x^3) + (343x - 7x^3) \\
&= -9x^3 + 341x + 630.
\end{align*}We want to find the roots of the polynomial $-9x^3 + 341x + 630 = 0$.  We can factor this as
\[-(x + 2)(9x^2 - 18x - 315) = 0.\]The quadratic factor has roots
\[x = \frac{18 \pm \sqrt{18^2 + 4 \cdot 9 \cdot 315}}{2 \cdot 9} = \frac{18 \pm \sqrt{12164}}{18} = 1 \pm \frac{11 \sqrt{10}}{9}.\]Therefore, the solutions are $\boxed{-2,1 - \frac{11 \sqrt{10}}{9}, 1 + \frac{11 \sqrt{10}}{9}}$.
ground_truth:
Subtracting the second column from the first column, we get
\[
\begin{vmatrix} 0 & 1 & 1 \\ x - 7 & 7 & -2 \\ x^3 - 343 & 343 & -8 \end{vmatrix}
= 0.\]The first column becomes all zeros when $x = 7,$ so this is one possible value of $x.$

Subtracting the third column from the first column, we get
\[
\begin{vmatrix} 0 & 1 & 1 \\ x + 2 & 7 & -2 \\ x^3 + 8 & 343 & -8 \end{vmatrix}
= 0.\]The first column becomes all zeros when $x = -2,$ so this is another possible value of $x.$

Expanding the last determinant along the first column, we get
\begin{align*}
\begin{vmatrix} 0 & 1 & 1 \\ x + 2 & 7 & -2 \\ x^3 + 8 & 343 & -8 \end{vmatrix} &= -(x + 2) \begin{vmatrix} 1 & 1 \\ 343 & -8 \end{vmatrix} + (x^3 + 8) \begin{vmatrix} 1 & 1 \\ 7 & -2 \end{vmatrix} \\
&= -9x^3 + 351x + 630 = 0.
\end{align*}Since we know that $x = 7$ are $x = -2$ are two solutions, we can take out a factor of $x - 7$ and $x + 2$, to get
\[-9(x - 7)(x + 2)(x + 5) = 0.\]Hence, the possible values of $x$ are $\boxed{7, -2, \text{ and } -5}.$

(Alternatively, by Vieta's formulas, the sum of the three roots of $-9x^3 + 351x + 630 = 0$ is 0, so the third root is $-7 - (-2) = -5.$)

\[-(x + 2)(9x^2 - 18x - 315) = 0.\]The quadratic factor has roots
\[x = \frac{18 \pm \sqrt{18^2 + 4 \cdot 9 \cdot 315}}{2 \cdot 9} = \frac{18 \pm \sqrt{12164}}{18} = 1 \pm \frac{11 \sqrt{10}}{9}.\]Therefore, the solutions are $\boxed{-2,1 - \frac{11 \sqrt{10}}{9}, 1 + \frac{11 \sqrt{10}}{9}}$.

There might be an error in the solution above because of lack of understanding of the question. Please correct the error, if any, and rewrite the solution. Only output the final solution \\boxed{$answer$}. I hope it is correct.'
inference:
The solution is correct.  There is no error.

$\boxed{-2,1 - \frac{11 \sqrt{10}}{9}, 1 + \frac{11 \sqrt{10}}{9}}$

\[
\begin{vmatrix} 0 & 1 & 1 \\ x - 7 & 7 & -2 \\ x^3 - 343 & 343 & -8 \end{vmatrix}
= 0.\]The first column becomes all zeros when $x = 7,$ so this is one possible value of $x.$

Subtracting the third column from the first column, we get
\[

= 0.\]The first column becomes all zeros when $x = -2,$ so this is another possible value of $x.$

Expanding the last determinant along the first column, we get
\begin{align*}
\begin{vmatrix} 0 & 1 & 1 \\ x + 2 & 7 & -2 \\ x^3 + 8 & 343 & -8 \end{vmatrix} &= -(x + 2) \begin{vmatrix} 1 & 1 \\ 343 & -8 \end{vmatrix} + (x^3 + 8) \begin{vmatrix} 1 & 1 \\ 7 & -2 \end{vmatrix} \\
&= -9x^3 + 351x + 630 = 0.
\end{align*}Since we know that $x = 7$ are $x = -2$ are two solutions, we can take out a factor of $x - 7$ and $x + 2$, to get
\[-9(x - 7)(x + 2)(x + 5) = 0.\]Hence, the possible values of $x$ are $\boxed{7, -2, \text{ and } -5}.$

(Alternatively, by Vieta's formulas, the sum of the three roots of $-9x^3 + 351x + 630 = 0$ is 0, so the third root is $-7 - (-2) = -5.$)
